results.title: Looking into the bits and pieces of a Micro
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to micro computers using non-technical language and shows how the various kinds of hardware and software work together in a computer system. Addresses everything from Central Processing Units (CPU’s) to Random Access Memory (RAM).
results.title_for_label: Looking into the bits and pieces of a Micro

results.title: Looking into spreadsheets
results.brief_description: Introduces the basic concepts behind spreadsheets by viewing a sample budget and explaining how it is set up in a typical spreadsheet. Provides excellent preparation for training in the spreadsheet program of your choice.
results.description: Introduces the basic concepts behind spreadsheets by viewing a sample budget and explaining how it is set up in a typical spreadsheet. Provides excellent preparation for training in the spreadsheet program of your choice.

results.title: Looking into paintings 1-6
results.creator_credit: Charles Mapleston and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: In this program Robert Cumming, Director of the Christie Fine Art Course, Norbert Lynton, Professor of Fine Art at Sussex University, and Alistair Smith, Keeper at the National gallery, help us look into paintings rather than just at them. They take us through some famous paintings, sometimes with the help of other experts, always with new ways of approaching the pictures, and with added insights, from contemporary artists, into the art of painting.

results.title: Looking into Ms-Dos: A Broader View
results.brief_description: MS-DOS, the most popular operating system, is often under-used or over-abused. This program offers a fuller understanding by detailing basic commands, file naming, hierarchical filing and backing up.
results.description: MS-DOS, the most popular operating system, is often under-used or over-abused. This program offers a fuller understanding by detailing basic commands, file naming, hierarchical filing and backing up.

results.title: Looking into hardware for business computing
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the hardware required to establish a business computer system. Suitable for persons using computers for the first time, those with only a rudimentary knowledge or those training others in their use.

results.title: Looking into Databases: Getting Started with Dbase IV
results.brief_description: This program offers a good introduction to computerised databases. It uses the setting of a modern day library to illustrate the concepts and operations of a database system, showing the advantages over a manual approach. A simple book retrieval system is then constructed using the facilities of dBase 1V.
results.title_for_label: Looking into Databases: Getting Started with Dbase IV

results.title: Looking into Databases: Developing with Dbase IV
results.brief_description: This program takes a new database user beyond the basics to an understanding of the meaning and operation of “relational” database systems. The narrator shows how a block diagram of a working library system can be developed and then using dBase 1V, “converted” into files and programs complete with modem menus.

results.title: Looking for spacethings
results.creator_credit: John Armstrong and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Jason and his dopey companion go looking for a thing from outer space. Meanwhile, a search party for the pair goes astray and Gonzo munches on a shoe. But sooner or later the spaghetti has to be cooked.
